Workspace

public Workspace()
Method Detail

getId

protected String getId()
returns this workspace's unique identifier.

Returns:

isOnline

protected boolean isOnline()
returns true if the user currently has an active connection to the server. when the user unplugs their internet cord, this will change to false. when the user plugs their internet cord back in, this will change to true after about 15 seconds.

Returns:

receiveMessage

public abstract void receiveMessage(String from,
                                    String message)
receives a message from another user that uses this workspace.

Parameters:
from -
message -

sendMessage

protected void sendMessage(String to,
                           String message)
sends a message. on the recipient's computer, receiveMessage will be called.

Parameters:
to -
message -

broadcastMessage

protected void broadcastMessage(String message)
same as sendMessage, but it sends it to all online users (excluding yourself). Currently, this just calls sendMessage() for every member of getOnlineUsers() that is not equal to getUsername(), so it offers no additional data transfer efficiency benefits.

Parameters:
message -

userStatusChanged

public abstract void userStatusChanged()
indicates that a user has signed on or off. the user may not be a member of this workspace, so no changes may have actually occured that concern this workspace.

getCreator

protected String getCreator()
returns the user that initially created this workspace.

Returns:

getUsername

protected String getUsername()
returns this user's username. if this is the same as getCreator(), then this is the user who created the workspace.

Returns:

userActivate

public abstract void userActivate()
indicates that the user took some action to activate this workspace, such as clicking on it's name in the launchbar.

listUsers

protected String[] listUsers()
lists all members of this workspace.

Returns:

listOnlineUsers

protected String[] listOnlineUsers()
lists all members of this workspace who are online.

Returns:

listOfflineUsers

protected String[] listOfflineUsers()
lists all members of this workspace who are offline.

Returns:

listAllowedUsers

protected String[] listAllowedUsers()
lists all members who are allowed to access this workspace. this may include users not included in listUsers(), which means that the user in question is allowed (via user specification) to use this workspace but has not chosen to do so. for example, when the workspace creator adds a user to the list of allowed users, it shows up here. when the user chooses to import or participate in this workspace, the user shows up in this list and listUsers().

Returns:

getStorageFile

protected File getStorageFile()
lists the folder that this workspace can use for data storage. it is not required to use this folder (if it is a folder sync workspace, for example, it would probably only use this folder to hold configuration such as which folder to synchronize)

Returns:

initialize

public abstract void initialize()
initializes this workspace. this is called for each workspace that the user is a member of when the user runs OpenGroove. if this method throws an exception, the exception will be printed to stderr, but the workspace will continue to be used.

setAttentionStatus

protected void setAttentionStatus(boolean attention)
if this is true, then the workspace is somehow marked as needing the users immediate (or quick) attention. this would usually involve displaying a warning icon next to the workspace, or bolding it, and displaying a balloon over the tray icon.

Parameters:
attention - true if the workspace needs attention, false to clear the attention needed status

setNewInformationStatus

protected void setNewInformationStatus(boolean newInfo)
indicates that the user should be notified that the workspace has new information, or otherwise requires the users (non-urgent) attention. this is pretty much the same as setAttentionStatus, except that this means that attention is not immediately required, inotherwords, this is not as urgent.

Parameters:
newInfo - true if this workspace has new info, or otherwise requires the user's (non-immediate) attention, false to clear the new info status

isCreator

protected boolean isCreator()
returns true if this user is the creator of the workspace, false otherwise.

Returns:

getMyVersion

protected String getMyVersion()
gets the version of the workspace that i am running. this is specified in the plugin descriptor for this workspace, in the version property. this can be used to send a message to the workspace creator or other computer to check that this workspace plugin is up-to-date enough to be used for this workspace. if the plugin descriptor file does not specify a version, this method returns null.

Returns:

getRegisteredType

protected String getRegisteredType()
gets the registered type of the workspace. this is usually specified in the workspace plugin descriptor, so it is usually known anyway.

Returns:

showConfigurationWindow

protected boolean showConfigurationWindow()
this method shows the configuration window. the configuration window has a tabbed pane in it. it has a few built-in tabs, such as choosing the workspace's name, choosing allowed users, inviting users, etc. then it puts one tab for each entry in getConfigurationComponents() in the config window. the config window has an OK button (currently no cancel button). the configuration window can also be shown by an option in the launchbar. if the configuration could not be shown, typically because another dialog is currently showing on the screen, false is returned.

showConfigurationWindow

protected boolean showConfigurationWindow(JFrame frame)
this method shows the configuration window. the configuration window has a tabbed pane in it. it has a few built-in tabs, such as choosing the workspace's name, choosing allowed users, inviting users, etc. then it puts one tab for each entry in getConfigurationComponents() in the config window. the config window has an OK button (currently no cancel button). the configuration window can also be shown by an option in the launchbar. if the configuration could not be shown, typically because another dialog is currently showing on the screen, false is returned. this method is the same as showConfigurationWindow with no arguments, except that instead of the configuration dialog being owned by the launchbar, it is owned by the frame passed in.

getConfigurationComponents

public abstract Map<String,JComponent> getConfigurationComponents()
gets the configuration tabs that should be added to the configuration window, in addition to the default tab. the key of each entry is the name of the tab to show and the value is the JComponent (usually a JPanel) to show inside the tabbed pane, when the tab is shown.

Returns:

configurationSaved

public abstract void configurationSaved()
indicates that the user clicked the OK button in the configuration window. settings in the JComponents returned from getConfigurationComponents should be saved.

configurationCancelled

public abstract void configurationCancelled()
NOT USED RIGHT NOW. when used, this method will be called when the cancel button is clicked in the configuration window. the configuration window doesn't have a cancel button right now, so this method is unused.

getName

protected String getName()
returns the name of this workspace. this may be configured by setName, or the user can configure it using an option in OpenGroove.

Returns:

setName

protected void setName(String name)
sets the name of this workspace. this is the name that shows up in the launchbar. usually, this is configured by the user (OpenGroove takes care of that), but if the workspace is unnamed (see isUnnamed()), then this method could check what the creator named it and set it's name to that.

Parameters:
name - the name to set (this method may take a bit to return, by which time the name will show up on the launchbar)

save

public void save()
stores this workspace's info to disk. this generally should be called only from within OpenGroove itself, and not by the workspace implementation.

isUnnamed

protected boolean isUnnamed()
returns true if the name of this workspace is the name that the system gives to workspaces when it first downloads them or creates them.

Returns:

getInfo

protected String getInfo(String user)
returns the information for this workspace, set by the user specified, or null if that user hasn't specified any info. this should not be called frequently, as it incures a request to the server.

Returns:

setInfo

protected void setInfo(String info)
sets the info for this workspace. this is your personal info, and any member of the workspace can read it. actually, anyone, with a bit of skill at coding, can read this even if they are not a member of a workspace, as long as they have an OpenGroove account.

Parameters:
info -

getProperty

protected String getProperty(String key)

setProperty

protected void setProperty(String key,
                           String value)
keys can only contain ascii visible chars, but not / or \ or .

getPluginMetadata

Properties getPluginMetadata()

setPluginMetadata

void setPluginMetadata(Properties pluginMetadata)

shutdown

public abstract void shutdown()
shuts down this workspace. there is no guarantee that this will be called, in particular, if OpenGroove exits as a result of the computer shutting down, then this will not be called. it is only guaranteed that it will be called if the workspace is to be shut down but the vm will continue running, such as if the workspace is deleted.

addNotification

protected void addNotification(TaskbarNotification notification,
                               boolean requestDisplay)

removeNotification

protected void removeNotification(TaskbarNotification notification)

listNotifications

protected TaskbarNotification[] listNotifications()

requestMessagingCapacity

protected void requestMessagingCapacity()
NOT IMPLEMENTED YET

requests additional messaging capacity between members of this workspace. this means that over the next few seconds, members of the workspace will be switched to a server that does not have many people on it. this should be called before a lot of messages will be exchanged, for example, if this workspace implements a 3D game, then when the game is about to start, this method should be called to alert OpenGroove that a lot of messages will be exchanged between the workspaces about where each person is in the 3D world.
